p: Biological relevance of the F1 fibril is also supported by accessibility of the α8 helix in this assembly ( Figure 3—figure supplement 3), which is partially buried in the F2-specific T1-T2 interface ( Figure 4). This helix harbors a binding site for SAP30, a component of a repressor complex that regulates transcription of the interferon-β promoter ( Le May et al., 2008). NSs arranged in the manner observed in NSs-ΔNΔC crystals would be able to bind to SAP30 and modulate SAP30 function.
